text: Hi guys, I am recently getting a lot of "Order XXX not present in blotter" in my flumine Strategy. What do these mean?

elements.text: Hi guys, I am recently getting a lot of "Order XXX not present in blotter" in my flumine Strategy. What do these mean?

text: it will be because you have restarted the framework and not using the middleware to put it back in memory

elements.text: it will be because you have restarted the framework and not using the middleware to put it back in memory

text: I didn't restart the framework in this case. Could it be because those orders are sent to the same market by a different flumine Strategy?

elements.text: I didn't restart the framework in this case. Could it be because those orders are sent to the same market by a different flumine Strategy?

text: nope

elements.text: nope

text: Orders sent by a different flumine instance would never appear in `market.blotter` ?

elements.text: Orders sent by a different flumine instance would never appear in
market.blotter

text: I feel like you aren't giving me much info to go off here, whatever you aren't telling me is the reason why you are getting this warning

elements.text: I feel like you aren't giving me much info to go off here, whatever you aren't telling me is the reason why you are getting this warning

text: I think my Strategy is saving completed orders which are not sent by the Strategy (I know this because the context in those orders is empty, whereas it would be filled for my own orders)

elements.text: I think my Strategy is saving completed orders which are not sent by the Strategy (I know this because the context in those orders is empty, whereas it would be filled for my own orders)

text: Which is affecting market.blotter.get_exposures() and making my strategy enter into a loop of replacing the same order again

elements.text: Which is affecting market.blotter.get_exposures() and making my strategy enter into a loop of replacing the same order again

text: :man-shrugging:
without code or some sort of example I have no idea

elements.text: without code or some sort of example I have no idea

text: haha okay I'll try to clean up an example

elements.text: haha okay I'll try to clean up an example

text: Other question tho, if I run 2 flumine instances in separate scripts and they send orders to the same market. Would the market.blotter.get_exposures() be per instance or would it consider the whole market (both instances)?

elements.text: Other question tho, if I run 2 flumine instances in separate scripts and they send orders to the same market. Would the market.blotter.get_exposures() be per instance or would it consider the whole market (both instances)?

text: is that what you are doing?

elements.text: is that what you are doing?

text: flumine separates using the hostname (customerStrategyRef) which is what is probably causing your issues

elements.text: flumine separates using the hostname (customerStrategyRef) which is what is probably causing your issues

root.text: Hi, is it possible to subscribe for score updates for tennis with betfairlightweight/flumine or the only way it is to call In Play Service api?

elements.text: Hi, is it possible to subscribe for score updates for tennis with betfairlightweight/flumine or the only way it is to call In Play Service api?

text: Let’s me rephrase, is it possible to create a score stream (similar to orders stream) rather calling In Play Service api every time I want to have a current score. Any help appreciated.

elements.text: Let’s me rephrase, is it possible to create a score stream (similar to orders stream) rather calling In Play Service api every time I want to have a current score. Any help appreciated.
